required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dario Blood Glucose Monitoring System - Android Devices Altitude Evaluation Study
clinical_study.official_title: Dario Blood Glucose Monitoring System - Android Devices Altitude Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the performance of a blood glucose monitoring system at high altitudes (approximately 10,000 feet). The performance is assessed via a reference method for glucose analysis (Yellow Springs Instrument 2300 STAT Plus Glucose Analyzer).

detailed_description.textblock: This study will be a non-randomized study conducted to assess the accuracy and performance of the Dario Blood Glucose Monitoring System at an elevated altitude. 50 subjects will be enrolled in this study. Participation includes a 15-20 minute visit to the clinical site where they will be consented. The participant will then receive a fingerstick to obtain capillary blood used to test the performance of the BGMS and to obtain a comparative glucose measurement on the reference method, the Yellow Springs Instrument 2300 STAT Plus Glucose Analyzer.

primary_outcome.description: The success criterion for the performance of the Blood Glucose Monitoring System at high altitude (approximately 10,000 feet above sea level) means that 95% of the blood glucose readings fall within 15mg/dL of the YSI reference value (for reference values less than 75 mg/dL) and within 20% (for reference values greater than or equal to 75 mg/dL).

arm_group.description: Single arm study Blood Glucose Monitoring System Altitude Performance

intervention.intervention_name: Blood Glucose Monitoring System Altitude Performance
intervention.description: Performance as assessed against a reference method at an altitude of approximately 10,000 feet.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to speak and read English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Has any condition that the principle investigator believes may interfere in the subject's participation in the trial.

group.title: Individuals With Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes and Individuals Without Diabetes
group.description: A total of 50 subjects diagnosed with type 1 or type 2 diabetes and individuals without diabetes. Age of subject is 18 years or older Able to speak and read English

group.title: Individuals With Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes and Individuals Without Diabetes
group.description: A total of 50 subjects diagnosed with type 1 or type 2 diabetes and individuals without diabetes. Age of subject is 18 years or older Able to speak and read English

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Successful Glucose Readings
outcome.description: The success criterion for the performance of the Blood Glucose Monitoring System at high altitude (approximately 10,000 feet above sea level) means that 95% of the blood glucose readings fall within 15mg/dL of the YSI reference value (for reference values less than 75 mg/dL) and within 20% (for reference values greater than or equal to 75 mg/dL).
outcome.population: Each subject will be measured 9 times with the Dario system: 3 strips lots for each of the three representative smart mobile devices (total of nine meters) under evaluation (150 strips per mobile device, total no. of strips 450).

group.title: Individuals With Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes and Individuals Without Diabetes
group.description: A total of 50 subjects diagnosed with type 1 or type 2 diabetes and individuals without diabetes. Age of subject is 18 years or older Able to speak and read English

measure.title: Number of Successful Glucose Readings
measure.description: The success criterion for the performance of the Blood Glucose Monitoring System at high altitude (approximately 10,000 feet above sea level) means that 95% of the blood glucose readings fall within 15mg/dL of the YSI reference value (for reference values less than 75 mg/dL) and within 20% (for reference values greater than or equal to 75 mg/dL).
measure.population: Each subject will be measured 9 times with the Dario system: 3 strips lots for each of the three representative smart mobile devices (total of nine meters) under evaluation (150 strips per mobile device, total no. of strips 450).
measure.units: Number of Glucose readings in range

reported_events.time_frame: The study was performed during one day

group.title: Altitude
group.description: Single arm study Blood Glucose Monitoring System Altitude Performance Blood Glucose Monitoring System Altitude Performance: Performance as assessed against a reference method at an altitude of approximately 10,000 feet.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Barbara Davis Center for Childhood Diabetes
